TopicTitle: New thread on Kerbal Galaxy bug for 1.0.4

Articles.Content: the last thread i thought i fixed it but it crashed, so i restarted and now its back the way it was before. it has like purple and black checkers on kerbin, and when i go to the Ksc, all i see is rainbow and the text saying "vechile assembly building" and when i click it it crashes. ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif)

> 
> the last thread

A link would be a nice thing here.

> 
> i thought i fixed it but it crashed, so i restarted and now its back the way it was before. it has like purple and black checkers on kerbin, and when i go to the Ksc, all i see is rainbow and the text saying "vechile assembly building" and when i click it it crashes. ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif)

So, no logs, no OS, no version, no list of mods? Help people help you.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/130723-Star-Systems-mod-for-KSP-1-0-and-possible-Bugfix-for-Kerbal-Galaxy](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/130723-Star-Systems-mod-for-KSP-1-0-and-possible-Bugfix-for-Kerbal-Galaxy) <-- last thread

And a system report:  Model Name: Mac Pro Model Identifier: MacPro5,1

Mod list:EVE,HotRockets,KAS,KIS,KAX,kerbal alarm clock,kerbal konstructs,HyperEdit,Mechjeb,other worlds planet pack,Circlier solar panels,planetary base INC,quick scroll,quick search,texture replacer,tweak scale, and Alternate resource panel.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-06T14:59:25Z" title="08/06/2015 02:59  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 6, 2015</time> by Starslinger999**
  
forgot a few things

Probably an issue with EVE or Texture Replacer, or running out of memory. Make a copy of your KSP directory and start removing mods one by one until it works again.

Also, next time post in the Modded Install Support section.
oh, didn't know bout that section :1 ill try that
And if it's following up on an existing help request, just reply to the existing thread.

> 
> Probably an issue with EVE or Texture Replacer, or running out of memory. Make a copy of your KSP directory and start removing mods one by one until it works again.
> Also, next time post in the Modded Install Support section.

I tried that and it will do it even with only mechjeb,kerbal alarm clock, and hyper edit. idk whats happening

- - - Updated - - -

> And if it's following up on an existing help request, just reply to the existing thread.

a Admin closed the thread ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif)

> 
> I tried that and it will do it even with only mechjeb,kerbal alarm clock, and hyper edit. idk whats happening

Then start adding mods back in until it stops working. This will require a process of elimination. Furthermore, when it does start happening you should be ready to post logs. I'll report this thread to have it moved to the correct subforum.

Good info for moving this thread where it belongs and add the proper prefix

I got it to work. removed a Texture replacer for the suits and KAS KIS and KAX and it works now ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) Thank you for the help guys

next time i will move it to the Mod Bug site thing instead of general ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
